options: ['Mary went to Hawaii on vacation.', 'Mary spent about $600 on her vacation.', 'On Wednesday she saw an old friend.', "The weather in Hawaii was a little terrible during Mary's vacation."]
questions: Which of the following is NOT true?
article: Mary had a nice summer vacation last year. She went to Hawaii  in July. Mary likes fruits, and the Hawaiian bananas and oranges were great. The weather was very fine, but sometimes it rained heavily. On Monday she went to the museum. It was an interesting place and not very crowded . On Tuesday she went to the mountains. On Wednesday she visited an old friend. They went to the movies in the evening. The movie was so funny that they laughed again and again. On vacation she felt like she she was a flying bird! The vacation cost  her about 600 dollars, but Mary had a fun time.
